titleStmt.title: W. C. Ireland et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6763

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
J. B. Welch, was fined $20. at the March Term of the Greenup Circuit Court for retailing without license. Welch did not keep a tipling house. He never sold liquor after the fine was imposed, and so far as the proof showed on one occassion. He is poor. has a family. which he is trying to support by teaching a small school. and the sum tho' small is much to him --
July 18th 1865.
Mr Welch came here from Carter County -- A Union refugee -- W. C. Ireland

W. C Ireland -- (I was not Welch's atto)
Geo M Thomas
Atto for Comth
Robert McAllister S. G. C.
Roch. F Robb. D C. G C C
K, M, Robb D, C, G, C, C
Wm Corum clerk Greenup Circuit and County Courts
John M Burns
E. C. Phister
Ed F Dulin

Greenup Cir Ct
vs
J. B. Welch
$20.
Remitted
3 Aug/65
